pros: Of course being a higher ed institution it comes with a certain sense of pride that you are ultimately preparing future generations to go out into the world and make it a better place.  There are many people at ODU who are truly passionate about what they are doing and they want to make an impact - not only because they feel that ODU has a place in bettering the Hampton Roads area but they know the students have great potential to deal with many of the pressing issues of the region, the state, and the country.
cons: This university lacks the ability to effectively communicate between departments and divisions.  The culture is one where it is not encouraged to partner with other departments to achieve a goal.  Because of that you have multiple missions happening with no clear strategy and very little rate of success.  Hard work is not always rewarded and unfortunately that leads to a mentality of just doing the bare minimum.  Mediocrity is acceptable and the leadership turns a blind eye to it.

pros: Working with the public in times of crisis for Police, Rescue and Fire Department needs. Assisting with crime control, health and well being of my community in a fast paced, always changing environment with hard working and loyal people who want to make a difference. Being on a University is energizing, and the opportunity to be around so many brilliant young minds wanting to improve the world and themselves is inspiring.
cons: Constant fasted pace environment and the stress that comes from having to make life and death decisions while always being on a time crunch can grind down the strongest person. There is an awesome team of people here, but it always feels as if it is understaffed. There is required daily duties, but the constant change and unpredictable pace plus being Alpha employee necessitating attendance during Hurricanes, Snow storms and every Civil disturbance is hard for families and mental health.

pros: I worked in IT.  It was a laid back environment, most of the time, maybe depending on your supervisor.  They give you lots of opportunities to learn, both on the job and via classes, etc.  Lots of holidays and time off.  You can get approval to telework occasionally after you've been there a year.  Pretty much everyone is very nice.  Also, it's a college campus, so you have lots of easy access to places to get food/coffee, there's a fitness center, etc.
cons: You have to take a lunch break, which I wasn't used to b/c I liked to work through lunch to leave early.  But, that's really not a big con, is it.  The salaries aren't great and you essentially don't get raises.  But, there are many perks to outweigh that.  One thing that really did bother me was paying for a parking pass, and then having to walk 10 minutes to get to my office, even after paying for a spot to park.  Plus, the traffic on Hampton can be rough at times.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros: I was in the Oceanography Department and my experience may not be representative of the conditions in bigger departments.  I taught seniors and graduate students and it was an easy, enjoyable work.  TA's for 100-level courses tend to be overworked.  Department handled all employment paperwork in a timely manner.
cons: No benefits! Dangerous campus and surrounding areas.  Nothing ever happened during daylight hours, but I feel like I was constantly getting safety alerts after dark.  Parking situation is unreal!  They are constantly getting rid of student commuter parking, forcing kids to park on the outskirts of the campus, which are unsafe.  Parking passes are very expensive on top of being useless due to not enough parking spots).  These are the only complains I have, but they are major ones.

pros:
Vacation is ample, if you are allowed to use it.

President seems great, but is either oblivious to a lot of what's happening or doesn't care.
cons:
While many lower level employees don't get paid a living wage, upper level administrators continue to reward themselves with 6-figure jobs & bonuses that equal more than some employees get paid in a quarter. 

Turnover in the SEES division seems to be at all-time high, and most current employees are looking for a way out but no one is asking "why?". 

Employees aren't supported in telling students "no" even when it's what they should hear at the time, so students easily get what they want by going up the chain.

Seem to be "in" groups and "out" groups. If you're in, you get lots of extra opportunities, promote quick and fast. If you're "out", you'll never have a chance at promoting. Skill seems to be irrelevant.

Depending on your department/role, lots of overtime and very stressful work. If you're on salary, that means no overtime pay. It's up to the individual boss if you get flex time or not.

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros: Great people to work with! Everyone I've encountered enjoys their job and are constantly looking for ways to make Old Dominion and themselves better. Overall a great place to work.
cons: Don't express conservative opinions. Super liberal campus (shocker), as  such, the conservative viewpoint is either attacked or dismissed. The parking situation is not ideal either. There are a lot of students, staff and faculty and not enough spaces. Additionally, employees have to pay for their own parking passes.

review_title: Good relationship with supervisors and fellow GRAs
pros: Given that ODU is a research-oriented institution, there seemed plenty of opportunities for me to get involved with various projects that fit with my knowledge and skill set. I didn't get the feeling that working as a GRA was treated as cheap labor; quite the contrary, in fact.
cons: Navigating the bureaucracy of the institution can be difficult, especially at the beginning of each new semester. Lots of paperwork and shuffling necessitated a few emails and follow-up phone calls to make sure everything to where it needed to be on time.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Good place to work while a student. Your supervisors will often let you work on homework/study in the office. Pay is decent although no benefits since it is part time. Very flexible about hours.
cons: Can often be a hassle to get your employment paperwork done. I once worked for two months before I was actually put into the system as an employee and received pay. This has happened multiple times. The College of Engineering needs to reorganize the Dean's Office. Many of the employees don't seem very intent on doing their jobs.

review_title: Great people & lots of different opportunities at ODU
pros: Diverse work force, many different part time and full time opportunities at ODU
cons: It is pretty much impossible to move up unless someone above you leaves. No raises for staff or admin for 5+ years. No raise again this year. Lots of employees get jobs and then change departments to get more pay or a better situation. Upper management is not in touch with those on the front line serving students.

review_title: University Fitness Center is the place to work on campus!
pros: There are many opportunities to work for the University, but the Fitness Center takes the cake!  They offer a flexible work schedule, while student employees work towards their college degrees.
cons: There were at times coordination problems between upper management and the facilities staff.  The communication at times seemed to  be a little broken between managers and the supervisors of each facility.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros: Not a big university but not small either, which I really like. Clean. Great recreation center. You can kayak just behind the rec center! Close to restaurants, bars, beach, camping site. Lots of activities for students.
cons: Low pay for GRA/TA compared to other universities (salary also depends on which department you work in). Not a lot of support for grad students. Most professors are away. Housing for students is expensive! No housing for students with family. Not a lot of courses being offered. Transportation is not good if you live off campus. Sketchy neighborhood in the other side of campus, where frequent robbery occurs.

review_title: Depends on where/who you work for.
pros: Real flexible and casual atmosphere working for Professors, they leave you alone as long as you get done what needs to be done.
cons: You can't get paid more than 20 hrs per week, even though you work more than that in a week. The payroll system limits the amount hours entered, trying to reduce students overworking and not focusing on school (good). Yet, they will only pay you for that amount so you have hours backing up and your paychecks are never that big (bad).

review_title: The career opportunities at Old Dominion University are fulfilling and easy, especially for on-campus students.
job_title: Art Library Staff in Norfolk, VA
pros: The careers at the University are easily accessible to those who live on campus or commute nearby. The amount of hours and pay is good as well.
cons: There are not a lot of jobs to choose from nor is there a large variety of jobs. One can either work at one of the three libraries on campus or work in a fast food restaurant in the middle of campus.

pros: As a graduate teaching assistant, you are contracted to work 20 hours/week. Sometimes you end up working less than this on average, especially if for an online class, and your pay is the same - salaried.
cons: It's not very fun to grade papers, especially if you don't know the students and didn't design the questions. They might complain to you that you were unfair, when you are barely familiar with the content.

review_title: Has potential -- Can it ever reach this potential?
pros:
University has many good programs, great professors, and excellent researchers.  There are also many superb administrative professionals and support staff.
ODU attracts many bright, achieving local students from local high schools.  Also, has many excellent distance students from a variety of places in graduate programs.
University is trying to grow and improve -- has added significant areas such as Student Success Center and College of Continuing Education and Professional Studies.
Very good distance education infrastructure.  Excellent university of individuals in the military, their spouses, and families.
Great geographic location that is not far from the beach, close to NC, easy drive or train ride to DC, yet also close to the mountains to the west.
cons:
University has experienced a lot of faculty attrition. The level of attrition exceeds anything I have ever seen in higher-ranked universities where I have been employed.  The number of tenured professors who have left in the ten years that I have been there is of great concern because this is just not common in quality institutions.
Salaries are generally very low and raises almost nonexistent.  If you come here be sure to negotiate the best salary possible.  You won't see a raise for many years.
University lacks identity and vision.  It is trying to be everything to everyone--research-intensive university, metropolitan university, top in distance education, extensive residential undergraduate institution, extensive distance doctoral programs, to name a few.  Much of this is done with little resourcing and comes on the backs of extensive faculty workloads.  
Administrators are by-and-large, very weak and lack vision, leadership, problem solving, and basic motivational skills.  There are some very good administers who are all near retirement.  There are many others who are just poor and the university has a hard time attracting and keeping high-quality administrators. They are also known for keeping poor administrators and loosing the good ones.  
In some colleges do not support tenured faculty without constant nudging from the faculty.  This takes away from teaching and research.
Research Foundation struggles to hire and retain staff making it difficult if you have research grants.
There is a lot of crime in Norfolk and there has been an extensive amount of crime near campus.

pros:
Flexible work hours
Telecommuting is really an option (for my job)
Family friendly
Can attend events on campus your schedule permits
Benefits are good
You are a state employee
cons: You are a state employee (in regards to salary and the ongoing negative perception that we don't do a thing).

review_title: The more one puts in, the more one gets out of it
pros: An organization in which the individual is cherished and allowed to excel. The more that one invests in the organization the greater the rewards, not only for ODU, but also for the person.
cons: It is a state academic institution, which brings with it some benefits such as security but also some cons, such as the amount of paperwork required for every little task. Decisions are also constrained by what people perceive to be state limiting factors, which in many cases don't even really exist.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros: Working with the Professors while going to school has been a great way for me to apply what I learn and experience many new technologies.  I get to interact with so many different people that have diverse programming and IT experience.
cons: I am graduating and need to find employment.  I would love to work here longer, but it is not possible.

pros: Great stepping stone and starting point for any career; environment conducive to growth! Team-oriented throughout all divisions. There are a lot of trainings, events, and meeting orchestrated for professional development, new ideas/strategies, and common purpose.
cons: Because the university/company is in a growth mode, in some situations, issues or problems are solved on the fly. Which is not necessarily a bad thing, but it does highlight organization weaknesses.

pros: I loved working for the Honors College. There were a lot of opportunities for growth and the leadership was very personable.They were always accommodating and understanding of my personal and academic responsibilities.
cons: Office politics. The people are mostly nice, but it is difficult to avoid politics. The best way to avoid those things is to not respond.

pros: I loved working for ODU Athletics.  Great workplace culture, great people, and it was a very engaging position for me.
cons: The only bad parts about working at ODU (and this applies to a lot of colleges) are having to pay for pricey parking passes, and the pay is generally slightly lower than in the private industry.  Other than that, it's a great place to work.

pros: I loved my coworkers, and the classes I taught. The students were diverse, creative and wonderful. They have fantastic continuing education for teachers.
cons: ODU wants to be a competitive research school, but they don't want to pay for it. Their salaries are significantly lower than other universities, their start-up packages are also lower. They do not negotiate when it comes to offers and do not give raises easily. I have also dealt with a fair amount of bullying from students and their parents (but that's happening everywhere).

job_title: Marketing and PR Coordinator in Norfolk, VA
pros: Working on campus was perfect when I was a student. I worked in multiple departments over my time there, and each employer was flexible and naturally understanding of times during the year when my schedule would get hectic. It also opened up opportunities such as partial scholarships and free meal plans.
cons: It was unfortunate that my employee had to end when I graduated- the job I was working at the time could not be filled by a non-student.

pros: The ODU Interfraternity Council gives you experience in developing plans, interpersonal skills, time-management skills, along with many other opportunities to get recognized by your peers.
cons: The only negative that I encountered during my time with the ODU Interfraternity Council was some lack of participation from peers.

job_title: Systems Support Analyst in Norfolk, VA
pros: Great benefits and melting pot of cultures.  You can get your college degree without paying for tuition.
cons: It's a state job.  It's not as grand as people think it is.  The salary isn't near where it should be at.  Very hard for existing staff to get promotions.

pros: Had a great department.  Excellent place to work if you are willing to deal with the status quo.  No one wants to update anything.  Most professors working in the past as they have on practical work experience.
cons: Outdated!!!!!  Professors do not show up to work.

pros: It is an environment that allows you to make contributions and creative and unique ways. Micromanagement is not existent in my role or office. My direct supervisor is "hands-off" which I love.
cons: Leadership is lacking. Nothing really gets accomplished in meetings...top leadership in my office unfortunately does not advocate for their employees. As a result, we have had excellent employees leave which has left of office short-staffed.

review_title: Could be better, could be worse
job_title: Computer Specialist III in Norfolk, VA
pros: Job Stability,  Good benefits, Manager does not "micro manage", Overall flexibility in how department is run
cons: Lack of direction from upper management,  IT Department lacks transparancy and communication among team members.  Often can't get assistance or guidance from management when needed, expected to perform tasks with little training or support that are out of my specialty.  LOW PAY FOR JOB EXPECTATIONS

pros: A good way to earn a little bit of money while attending school full time.  Typically flexible scheduling to work around class schedules.  Good chance to interact with both faculty and other students.
cons: They don't like you doing other activities such as internships while working as a graduate student. Pay isn't very high.  Real perk is reserved for foreign students who receive in-state tuition rates if selected to be a graduate student.

review_title: Working for Housing and Residence Life
pros: You make many connections with different department. This is also a very prestigious title to hold at ODU. The paid is by stipend, so even if you don't put forth a lot of effort, you would still get the same salary. Housing is also reduced to 1K per semester.
cons: Some of the policy seems very riddiclous. It's actually a very easy job that doesn't push you to think intellectually and doesn't require many hours.

pros: This job has a lot of flexibility and I am allowed to pick a schedule that fits my schedule. I am a college student and this is very important to me. Education is important.
cons: The pay could be a little more. It's a bit stressful being a Team Lead IT Consultant and only making 7.75 per hour. I feel as if I am one of the hardest workers out of the bunch.

review_title: Absolutely loved my time at grad school at ODU
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros:
very diverse both faculty and student body
fast developing
very interesting and current new research and outreach initiatives
excellent physics department
cons:
still a commuter campus, no sense of community 
sometimes opposition from clicks formed among some faculty and higher management 
corporate politics is not good for higher education institutions

review_title: Not a bad place for obtaining a graduate degree
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros: Nice area to live, some excellent faculty members, lots to do in the surrounding cities, growing as a research intensive institution
cons: Administration can be slow and there are few funding opportunities for grad students. Some of the buildings are really old but ODU has been slowly upgrading them.

pros: There are many opportunities depending on your field of interests and just as many resources to support them.  Knowledgeable staff as well.
cons: Many opportunities require effort on the seekers behalf.  Not a good place for those with self motivational problems.  Management is poor and unorganized.

pros: A new and coming research university with full of growth opportunity in select cutting edge research areas. There are several leading researchers in staff
cons: As a result of being a younger school, vision is somewhat limited to short term goals. Increasing number of students require a larger campus which is not there yet.

pros: The school has a state of the art student recreation center that is available to faculty at a reasonable monthly rate.
cons: Many faculty members teaching career preparation classes in the college of education have no career experience or academic background in the subjects they teach.  They're just there because they are someone's friend.

pros: It is a very good university. Most of  the students worked hard, and the teachers are very responsible and patient.
cons: The surrounding area is not very safe and the parking position is very limited which is bad for local commuters .

review_title: An university with an uncertain future
pros: It is located in Norfolk and near Virginia beach. The climate of that region is great. The living cost is not too high.
cons: The school has some budget problems. It tried to turn into a research oriented school, but it is still largely a teaching oriented school.

job_title: Adjunct Assistant Professor in Norfolk, VA
pros: Great colleagues, excellent facilities, and a very good benefits package make ODU a very good place to work. There are also lots of great cultural activities going on all the time, and staff get free admission to most.
cons: Although it's a great place to work, the two downsides are probably parking and the overall safety around the campus. Steer clear of the neighborhoods around campus.

review_title: I have a great experience and wish I could have stayed longer.
job_title: Team Lead IT Consultant in Norfolk, VA
pros:
Diverse environment, peaceful, plenty of things to do on campus, restaurants and places to shop are close by, and the professors are great.
Easy to find a job and my manager was great.
cons: Finding parking is a hassle, not too safe past 10pm if you're walking off campus but the security is getting better.

pros:
Learn a lot in this school via online classes (live video-streaming) with the ability to communicate directly with the professor.
ENMA professors are very knowledgeable and willing to help if you don't understand.
Education gained can and will be applied to the real world.
cons:
Mostly, all other communications are done via e-mail, sometimes can be timely response. 
Some teamwork projects can be a pain due to coordination efforts or there lack of.

pros: There are quite a few to list. The managers are wonderful and very mentoring. The other workers were very knowledgable.
cons: I can't think of many, but the pay could always be a little higher.  Other than that I am very satisfied with the position

review_title: Great opportunity for part time student work.
job_title: Admissions Telecounselor (Student Worker) in Norfolk, VA
pros:
Old Dominion University has a significant amount of opportunities for student to work on campus during their time enrolled.
Pay raises each year you progress in school (Freshman, Sophomore, Junior, Senior).
Great work atmosphere and environment.
They believe that school comes first, so opportunities are allotted for time off when needed.
cons:
Limited to working no more than 20 hours a week.
Hourly pay is new minimum wage.

review_title: This company was a great place to work at.
job_title: Student Administrative Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros:
The job I had was a student job so whenever the school was closed, I had time off.
They were very nice and knew how to make me feel comfortable.
They were understanding about conflicts with balancing work and class.
cons: I had some conflicts with getting to class on time and doing things that needed to be done in between work and class.

pros: Great work envirnoment, wonderful faculty. Very supportive.
cons: limited number of classes adjunct can teach. No benefits for adjuncts: must pay for parking pass, gym membership, no grants for development. The local community college provides these for their faculty - it's kind of embarassing that ODU does not.

pros:
- Easy job, not hectic at all even when busy
- Not very busy except during textbook buying and buy back season
- Managers do not micromanage you at all
- With the exception of 1 person, everybody was great to work with
- Very flexible as a student
cons:
- Unless you work during football games, don't expect many hours on the off season.
- Strictly minimum wage
- No benefits at all

pros:
- Most of the academic folks are good people, especially the professors who were helpful.
- The working environment was also good, the camaraderie among the graduate students in my department was a delight. 
- Nice place to live.
cons:
- However, the administration did not seem to take too much pride in the work of the GAs/ TAs. 
- The benefits pale in comparison to most research universities.

review_title: ODU takes care of its employees
pros: Lots of opportunities to learn new skills through work, plus a very robust calendar system to allow employees scheduling flexibility while also ensuring shifts get filled.
cons: Bureaucratic, significant change requires even more significant back-and-fourth communication to achieve.

pros: There are not really any good reasons to work at ODU. Perhaps other departments are better but Student Health Services gets no respect from "upstairs".  The only good thing are the employees in Student health. Your coworkers will be what get you through. If you are a full time employee, however, you will enjoy state benefits. As a part time employee though you will not receive any benefits.  I've heard positive things from other departments within the university and for the most part employees in student health are one in a million.
cons: Would not recommend this. Other departments at ODU may be okay to work for. However, Student Health Services is not appreciated by any of the "upper crusted" management. Within the department, supervisors are lazy and very few actually perform their supervisory role; instead just collect a paycheck. It was very rare to see the supervisor step up and fill in for someone who may have missed work. This type of thing seemed to be beneath them. The only thing that this department cares about or is even remotely worried about are the students; which in turn just results in spoon feeding these COLLEGE aged children. I was actually told by a supervisor once that "the employees needs are not important in the Health Center." Any place that treats their employees this way and believes that their employees needs are not important or of value is not a place I would recommend working. As a part time employee they truly treat you like the low man on the totem pole. They think that you have no life and that your life should revolve around the health center, as a part time employee-I think NOT! Another thing is that they think part-time means working every day. This is fine if a person is okay with shorter shifts, perhaps an older individual but for most people a 4 hour shift is not really worth the time of driving and fighting traffic. Spreading the allotted 29 hours over 5 days is ridiculous. This leads to the next downfall: part-time employees are limited to 29hours/week which is about 1500 hours per year. As the old saying goes, a team is only as good as their leader and this department needs to take this advice and seriously look at who the "leaders" are and do an overhaul. It is actually laughable the amount of crap this place puts their employees through especially the low ranking part timers. It is also shameful the way they treat employees that have been here for many years. There is no support for these employees. Also to note, I have never had a supervisor that tells your personal business to other employees until I worked here. Working in health care you think they would know a thing or two about confidentiality. When I tell my supervisor something in confidence I expect it to be kept that way but not the case here. Just proving how unprofessional the supervisors are.

pros: Flexible work hours, ability to further explore fundamental information, and help other students/network with them.
cons: Can be slow, can also be overwhelming with amount of students coming in, sometimes people come in expecting answers to be given to them.

review_title: I love my job, but I wish they paid more!
pros: The University is a great place to work. The people are friendly, the organization is constantly trying to improve and they "CARE" about their clients and their staff!
cons: The pay should be better.

pros: Reasonable Management, able to take class while working, campus environment is not bad at all. Benefit is also pretty nice.
cons: As a school, it is not as "fast" as some companies, while it is maybe easier to work with. But sometime when you are trying to get some done you had to wait forever for others to response.

pros: As an adjunct instructor you will be able to create your own syllabus, etc. The shared offices have enough computers and the students are a good group.
cons: Pay for adjuncts is very poor, as it is everywhere. Whether or not you get courses depends on the department chair, at least in my department, and this one is very arbitrary but YMMV.

review_title: Wonderful environment of study with lots of International students
pros: Student-friendly university and very safe and peaceful area to live.
cons: It's a fast-growing university so if you are an international student then you might be the first person from your country and that's why you might have to help the administration to understand the grades of your mark sheet.

review_title: Very good place to advance in your career.
job_title: IT Technician Student Worker in Norfolk, VA
pros: It is great to work at ODU while being a student. You have a flexibility needed and any assistance you may need you can obtain. You also gain much experience if the job relates to your degree area.
cons: The pay is not high enough

pros: Loved the student interaction.  The campus and the passion for the other instructors subject
cons: Departments are a little slow to make adjunct instructors feel welcome

job_title: Social Media Specialist in Norfolk, VA
pros: Managers tend to work completely around class schedules, since they can access them while doing the schedule. Studying on the job during idle time is not unheard of. Working a non-food/service position at a University beefs up your resume significantly.
cons: Low pay, can be boring at times, PARKING!

review_title: Office of Intercultural Relations is am awesome department to work for!!
pros: Great teams to work with.  Each student organization is like it's own family and are very inviting and outgoing. Very positive work environment.
cons: Can be hard to get approval for venues on campus and funding for programs that are out of the box.

review_title: Very good people who work very hard,  many of whom have a quality mission mindset.
job_title: Research Assistant Professor in Norfolk, VA
pros: Smart, talented people who all work hard, many of whom have international reputations.
cons: Severely underpaid compared to institutions both at a state and national level. This is particularly true of Arts and Letters.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros: Good place to work, I have an excellent advisor, good at advising, knows the subject well,  Good work life balance advocated by senior managementGood benefits, nice working place
cons: Low salary,Some aspects still in slow old-fashioned mode of taking things slowly. Too much non-value added activities

pros: Great benefits with a lot of opportunities to grow as a professional . Also great coworkers and students.  A lot of down time during breaks.
cons: They don't always do a good job at considering prior experience and education when it comes to starting salaries. Try to negotiate if possible.

review_title: The engineering program is progressing.  They are adding new programs and producing qualified graduates.
pros: urban area with access to a variety of culture and shops.  Classrooms are centrally organized and involvement is easy to achieve.
cons: campus security is poor.  The area surrounding the college is run-down and dangerous.

job_title: Information Technology Specialist II in Norfolk, VA
pros: Great opportunities to learn and develop skill sets if you are competitive enough to take advantage of educational benefits and projects that you get put on.
cons: Some times working at a great places has a slow promotion progression when they employee around usually have 10-12 years on you.

review_title: Need to have compensation regarding the pay skill with good skill employee
pros: An education institute to earn a degree while working.
cons: Pay is not balanced among the various departments.

review_title: Good place to work, friendly faculty
job_title: Post Doctoral Research Associate in Norfolk, VA
pros: ODU has a very diverse campus. There are lots of international and military students, and the average student tends to be older and more mature.
cons: The environs has a very high crime rate. Students are robbed sometimes at gun point, albeit mostly at night.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros:
-Flexible work schedule 
-Able to gain experience working with different Web development platforms
-Friendly coworkers and staff
-Opportunity to help students and make their experience at ODU more positive
cons:
-Unencouraging work environment 
-Sometimes difficult to get students excited about the course
-Experience will vary greatly across department and course responsible for

review_title: ODU's Student Success Center makes for a great way to earn money and develop professionally
job_title: Spanish Tutor, Supplemental Instructor in Norfolk, VA
pros:
-room for professional growth
-job varies day to day
-most everyone is pleasant to deal with 
-allows for creativity to shine while providing structure
cons: -not every single person is always the best but that's true everywhere

review_title: Research Assistant Gregory A Lumsden Trading Room
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros: Access to Bloomberg terminals. Get to stay on top of the market all day. Fun and Creative work Enviroement
cons: No cons other than sometimes it can get lonely when market is closed

pros: Experienced Professors with a lot of industrial and educational expertise, Thoughts and ideas are accepted, Best infrastructure and lab with fully loaded equipments to work on.
cons: Compensation and benefits are comparatively less as the civil engineering department is currently spending lot of money in buying inventory.

pros: Was able to work with the professors to adjust schedule and allow for flexibility with research
cons: Lack of coordination in the department.  Since it was a senior design course had to work with students from various faculty members and all had much different expectations of students

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros: If you have a good professor as a mentor, then working as a graduate research assistant can be great!
cons: ODU has issues with who it gives funding too. There were definitely some situations where I couldn't believe they were giving money to one department and not another.

review_title: Not the type of employer you'd imagine.
pros: Vacations, breaks and decent benefits.
cons: The "leadership" has no connection with the rest of the employees.  Not enough financial support for the required work.

pros: Laissez faire, light monitoring,  adequate resources
cons: Inconsistent messages, lazy hiring process with HR ("emergency hires" ),  and lack of development initiatives

pros: Its growing and dept is trying to hire better faculty. Current faculty is trying hard to turn the dept into a full fledged research facility.
cons: They've been a teaching university and the inertia is weighing them down from becoming a top notch dept.

pros: Great balance between having to work and study for classes. Really good place to work at and the people are amazing
cons: Student workers only make minimum wages and their hours are limited to only 20 hours a week.

review_title: RA at ITS ODU is the best job to work on campus while studying
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Norfolk, VA

cons: Managing studies along with the job is hectic but manageable.

review_title: Best place to get your career started
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Norfolk, VA

review_title: Great Place to get experience, but unless your tenured look to move on

pros: good things work for ODU.you college programs,you have the credit union,you have other special programs

review_title: Graduate Research Assistant at ODU MSVE Department
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Norfolk, VA

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Norfolk, VA

review_title: Graduate Research Assistant at Department of Physics
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros:
Great pay compared to other departments at the university.
Great work environment for the graduate students.
Great faculty and staff.
cons: Support for graduate student health insurance would be valuable.

pros: Flexible schedule and room to explore different teaching methods.
cons: Low pay-lack of opportunity for further development or career progression.

review_title: Good place to start your career
pros: The professors are very accessible.
cons: Norfolk is still a developing market. Lots of computer science jobs, but engineers might need sometime to find a job

review_title: Great position for a grad student
pros: Make your own hours, very nice work environment, very low stress
cons: balancing this job and a full course load can be challenging at times that are busy, like during the career fair.

pros: Great work life balance & amazing health insurance.
cons: Pay is low, they don’t care if you get sick

job_title: MFA Program Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros: Engaging work, informed and friendly colleagues, opportunity to network and interact with elites in my field of study (poetry).
cons: Funding for the fine arts is barely adequate, Norfolk area is not very exciting

job_title: Graduate Student Research Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros: tight knit office, flexible,  everyone is so nice, the work is beneficial, skills are applicable to a lot of fields.
cons: not a lot of money if you are providing for yourself.

review_title: Fellow co-workers were friendly. Supervisors were respectful and caring.
pros: Everyone was easy to get along with.
cons: It could be a bit disorganized at times.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Norfolk, VA
